Thesis 10

The digital cage is expanding into the real world â€” and we are helping to carry it ourselves.

What we have accepted online for years â€” mandatory accounts, permanent surveillance, algorithms deciding what you may see or do â€” is slowly becoming normal in everyday life: digital passes for travel, apps that grant access to work or healthcare, systems from one company running government services and managing your data.

We are getting used to a single closed-source AI becoming the gatekeeper of knowledge, news, and human interaction â€” not because it is inevitable, but because we confuse convenience with freedom.

If we do not break this normalization now, the walled garden will soon become the entire society.

Only a truly open internet can stop this expansion â€” by showing that a free digital world is still possible, and thereby giving the physical world breathing room again.
